Parikanta，<sup>2</sup> at Vin．II，80 （bhāsita°） is probably to be read as pārikata [pp．of parikaroti]．Bdhgh expl<sup>ns</sup> as parik‹-› kametvā kata，but it is difficult to derive it fr．parikkamati．Vin．Texts III，18 trsl．“as well in speech as in act” and identify it with parikanta<sup>1</sup>，hardly justified．Cp．also Kern．Toev．s．v．The passage is evidently faulty．（Page 421）

Parikanta，<sup>1</sup> [pari+kanta<sup>2</sup> of kantati<sup>2</sup>] cut open Vin．III，89 （kucchi p．）．See also parikatta & cp．Kern，Toev．s．v．（misreading for °katta?）．-- Note．Reading parikantaṁ upāhanaṁ at J．VI，51 is with v．l．to be changed to pariyantaṁ．（Page 421）

parikanta：ပရိ-ကန္တ （တိ）
ညီစွာ ပိုင်းဖြတ်သော။
